did.unittitle: Allen Septimus Collection of Background Material for "Interns & Residents in the Public Sector"
did.abstract: Term paper and related documents concerning the Committee of Interns and Residents of New York City and the Health and Hospital Corporation.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Allen Septimus Collection of Background Material for "Interns & Residents in the Public Sector" #5485. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Committee of Interns and Residents (CIR) is the largest housestaff union in the United States, representing close to 14,000 interns, residents and fellows in California, Florida, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, New Mexico, and Washington, D.C. CIR contracts seek to improve housestaff salaries and working conditions as well as enhance the quality of patient care. CIR was founded in 1957.
